meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your old pal, back with another review that's sure to make you laugh and maybe even inspire you to pick up a controller.

Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a game that's got everyone talking - including the critics. And let me tell you, they're not wrong. This remastered edition of the classic PlayStation games is pure gold (or should I say, pure bird?).

First off, let me give props to IGN for their review: "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is such a tremendous turnaround from 2015's disastrously dismal Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5 that it's difficult to believe they share even a shred of DNA." Preach, brother!

GameSpot agrees, saying that the game "nails so much about that original Tony Hawk experience." And who can blame them? The game is chock-full of retro charm, with levels that are lovingly designed odes to the past. You'll be reminiscing about the good ol' days (or if you're a younger player, learning what all the fuss was about back in the day).

But don't just take my word for it - check out Game Informer's review: "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 and 2 makes the experience of playing through these games again feel fresh and current." Fresh? Current? More like retro-tastic and totally tubular!

And then there's Gaming Age, with their glowing praise: "Tony Hawk Pro Skater 1 and 2 is easily one of the best remasters available on the market today... The gameplay is still timeless..." Yeah, yeah, we get it - the game is awesome. (But seriously, how can you go wrong with a game that's got the name Tony Hawk attached to it?)

Worth Playing has some minor gripes, but even they can't deny the game's charm: "It has trimmed most of the fat that's typical of these projects and unapologetically focused on its original core experience..." Core experience? More like core-llaborative experience! (Sorry, I had to.)

And finally, Cheat Code Central is just plain gushing: "Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2 is a perfect remaster. It feels the way you expect the game to and has everything I loved about these two games." Ah, yes - even the critics agree that this game is the bee's knees (or should I say, the skate's wheels?).

All in all, Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 is a game that'll have you ollie-ing with joy. So what are you waiting for? Grab your board and get ready to shred!
